intro: Lippia betulifolia, commonly known as silverleaf lippia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its silver-green foliage and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in dry or rocky soils. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Lippia betulifolia is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and aromatic properties.
